item.title: Gautam Gambhir Likened To Greg Chappell, 'Irritated' BCCI Official Slams Coach's Personal Aide - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir Likened To Greg Chappell, 'Irritated' BCCI Official Slams Coach's Personal Aide

Publication Date: January 14, 2025

Source: NDTV

Amid a review of the Indian cricket team's performance in Australia, tensions arise between coach Gautam Gambhir and senior players regarding team culture and communication issues.

  • The BCCI has reviewed the Indian cricket team's performance in Australia.
  • Gambhir's relationship with senior players is reportedly strained due to differing views on team culture.
  • There are concerns regarding Gambhir's coaching style, drawing comparisons to former coach Greg Chappell.
  • BCCI officials express irritation over Gambhir's personal assistant’s involvement with the team.
  • The Indian dressing room appears uneasy ahead of the Champions Trophy from February 19 to March 9.
“The 'Chappell Way' doesn't work in India...players will stay, Gambhir will go.”

As the team prepares for the Champions Trophy, internal dynamics suggest challenges that may affect performance.

item.title: 'Imagine, I am only in the team because it is my farewell Test': Ravichandran Ashwin opens up on retireme - The Times of India
item.description:
Imagine, I am only in the team because it is my farewell Test: Ravichandran Ashwin opens up on retirement decision

Publication Date: Not Provided Source: Not Provided

Indian cricketer Ravichandran Ashwin shared his feelings regarding retirement in a recent interview.

  • Ashwin is participating in his farewell Test match.
  • He expressed mixed emotions about leaving the sport.
  • Fans and teammates supported his decision.
“Imagine, I am only in the team because it is my farewell Test,” Ashwin stated.

This farewell match marks a significant moment in Ashwin's career, with fans reflecting on his contributions to cricket.

item.title: SA20: Joburg Super Kings spin trio dismantle Durban's Super Giants in 28-run victory - The Times of India
item.description:
SA20: Joburg Super Kings spin trio dismantle Durban's Super Giants in 28-run victory

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In a thrilling match, the Joburg Super Kings delivered a strong performance to secure a 28-run victory against Durban's Super Giants, primarily attributed to the excellent bowling of their spin trio.

  • The Joburg Super Kings won by 28 runs.
  • The spin bowlers played a crucial role in the victory.
  • Details on individual player performances were highlighted.
  • The win strengthens Joburg Super Kings' position in the tournament.
“Our spin attack was pivotal in turning the game in our favor,” said the Joburg captain.

This victory not only showcases the strength of the Joburg Super Kings but also sets a competitive tone for the remainder of the tournament.

item.title: "Virat Kohli will not play even one Ranji Trophy match": Delhi official exposes star cricketer - Crictoday
item.description:
Virat Kohli Will Not Play Even One Ranji Trophy Match, Says Delhi Official

Publication Date: [Date of Publication] Source: The Indian Express

Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA) secretary Ashok Sharma has expressed disappointment that star cricketer Virat Kohli will not participate in the Ranji Trophy, urging him to draw inspiration from players who prioritize domestic cricket.

  • Ashok Sharma's call for Virat Kohli to play in the Ranji Trophy.
  • Kohli last played for Delhi in 2012; faces criticism for not participating in domestic games.
  • Comparison with Mumbai players who compete in domestic cricket despite being contracted with the Indian team.
  • BCCI's direction emphasizes the importance of participating in the Ranji Trophy.
  • Ashok Sharma believes Kohli will not play even a single match for Delhi.
“The BCCI has issued directives in this regard but I don’t think Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant are going to represent Delhi even in one match.” - Ashok Sharma

This issue underscores a growing concern regarding the commitment of top players to domestic cricket, an area that seems to be lacking emphasis in Northern India.

item.title: Watch: Rohit Sharma Bats With Mumbai's Ranji Captain Ajinkya Rahane At Wankhede Stadium - News18
item.description:
Watch: Rohit Sharma Bats With Mumbai's Ranji Captain Ajinkya Rahane At Wankhede Stadium

Date: January 14, 2025

Source: News18

India’s Test and ODI captain, Rohit Sharma, trained with Mumbai Ranji Trophy players at Wankhede Stadium, sharing the field with captain Ajinkya Rahane.

  • Video shared by Star Sports shows Rohit batting at the iconic stadium.
  • Rohit arrived for practice after informing the Mumbai Cricket Association.
  • In a viral clip, Rohit and Ajinkya Rahane can be seen training together.
  • Rahane led India to a Test series win over Australia in 2020-21 and recently won the Ranji Trophy.
  • Mumbai faces Jammu & Kashmir in the upcoming Ranji match.
“Rohit has not played a Ranji match since 2015.”

Despite recent struggles with form, Rohit is set to represent India in the upcoming ODI series against England and the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

item.title: BCCI Set New Guideline For Indian Cricketers, Wives Won't Be Allowed To Stay For Entire Tour: Report - News18
item.description:
BCCI Implements New Guidelines Restricting Wives' Participation on Tours

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: News18

This article discusses the new guidelines set by the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) following a disappointing performance by the Indian cricket team. Indian players' wives will now be allowed to stay with them for only a limited time during overseas tours.

  • The BCCI has decided that players' wives and families can stay for a maximum of two weeks during overseas tours lasting 45 days or more.
  • For shorter tours, the stay is limited to a maximum of seven days.
  • This decision aims to address performance issues reportedly affected by family presence during tours.
  • The board will also enforce that all players travel together in the team bus, regardless of their status.
  • Head coach Gautam Gambhir's manager will not have access to the team hotel or VIP box during matches.
“Keeping in view the team unity, now all the players will travel by the team bus only. No matter how big a player is, he will not be allowed to travel separately,”

These new regulations emphasize the BCCI's focus on team cohesion and performance amid recent underwhelming results in international series.

item.title: Man Utd, Tottenham Alert as Juventus, PSG Finalizing Deal for £50M-Rated Talent - PSG Talk
item.description:
Man Utd, Tottenham Alert as Juventus, PSG Finalizing Deal for £50M-Rated Talent

Date: January 14, 2025

Source: PSG Talk

Randal Kolo Muani’s future at Paris Saint-Germain is uncertain as he is a target for multiple clubs in the January transfer window. Recent reports suggest he may be loaned to Juventus, with Tottenham Hotspur and Manchester United also interested.

  • Kolo Muani has struggled for playing time at PSG, totaling just 453 minutes this season.
  • Juventus and PSG are close to finalizing a loan agreement for the striker until June.
  • Tottenham prefers an option to buy, while Juventus is negotiating a deal quickly.
  • The forward has other proposals from Premier League clubs.
  • Kolo Muani's transfer fee is reported to be around £50 million.
Juventus and PSG are on the verge of closing a verbal agreement for Randal Kolo Muani on loan until June. Kolo Muani will make his decision in the next hours, with more proposals on the table from Premier League. Juve are pushing to seal the deal as soon as possible. — Fabrizio Romano

This transfer situation remains fluid as clubs push for Kolo Muani's services, highlighting the competitive nature of the January transfer window.

item.title: Virat Kohli should take a leaf out of Mumbai cricketers and play for Delhi in domestic cricket: DDCA secretary - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Virat Kohli should play Ranji Trophy’: Seek inspiration from Mumbai cricketers turning up for domestic cricket, says DDCA secretary

Publication Date: Unknown

Source: The Indian Express

DDCA secretary Ashok Sharma emphasizes the importance of Virat Kohli and other top players participating in domestic cricket, like the Ranji Trophy, suggesting it would benefit their performance at the international level.

  • Kohli's name has been included in the probables list for Delhi’s Ranji Trophy matches.
  • Rishabh Pant has confirmed his availability for the upcoming match against Saurashtra.
  • Sharma urges Kohli to take inspiration from Mumbai players who regularly participate in the Ranji Trophy.
  • Domestic game time has become crucial, especially after India's recent losses in Test matches.
  • DDCA president Rohan Jaitley supports the participation of Kohli but acknowledges multiple factors affecting his involvement.
“If you don’t give importance to domestic cricket, you will never get the players that you want in Test cricket.” - Gautam Gambhir

In conclusion, the DDCA stresses that participation in domestic cricket is vital for maintaining player fitness and performance, particularly for high-profile cricketers like Kohli.

item.title: India squads for England ODI series and Champions Trophy Highlights: India, Pakistan only teams yet to announce squads - Firstpost
item.description:
India squads for England ODI series and Champions Trophy Highlights

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Firstpost

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is expected to announce the squads for the England ODI series and the 2025 Champions Trophy shortly. The current focus is on finalizing preparations as other teams have already revealed their squads.

  • The BCCI's new squad announcement is slated for January 18 or 19.
  • India is in Group A for the Champions Trophy alongside Bangladesh, Pakistan, and New Zealand.
  • Prominent discussions regarding player selections, including Harbhajan Singh's comments on snubbing certain players, have emerged.
  • Rohit Sharma is being backed to train effectively before the upcoming series.
“Virat Kohli knows he is past his best... The selectors should know.” - David Lloyd

As anticipation builds for both the ODI series and Champions Trophy, significant public interest and discussions around player performances are ongoing.

item.title: Rishabh Pant confirms availability for Delhi's Ranji Trophy clash against Saurashtra - The Times of India
item.description:
Rishabh Pant Confirms Availability for Delhi's Ranji Trophy Clash Against Saurashtra

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Rishabh Pant has announced his readiness to play in the upcoming Ranji Trophy match against Saurashtra, marking his return to competitive cricket.

  • Pant's participation comes after a lengthy recovery from a serious car accident.
  • He aims to help Delhi secure a win in the important domestic tournament.
  • This will be Pant's first match since his recovery, showcasing his determination and resilience.
“I am excited to get back on the field and contribute to my team’s success,” Pant expressed.

Rishabh Pant's return is a significant boost for Delhi's squad, as he is a key player with experience in high-pressure situations.

item.title: Napoli begin hunt for Kvaratskhelia replacement: Garnacho and Adeyemi options - Football Italia
item.description:
Napoli Searches for Kvaratskhelia Replacement: Garnacho and Adeyemi Considered

Publication Date: March 3, 2024

Source: Football Italia

Napoli are ramping up their search for a replacement for Khvicha Kvaratskhelia following his transfer to PSG for a fee exceeding €70m. The club is exploring options such as Manchester United's Alejandro Garnacho and Borussia Dortmund's Karim Adeyemi.

  • Kvaratskhelia's move to PSG is confirmed, expected to be finalized soon.
  • Antonio Conte of Tottenham has recommended Garnacho as a prime target.
  • Negotiations with Garnacho's agent are underway but transfer fee disputes exist.
  • Napoli is considering a €45m offer, while United demands around €70m.
  • Adeyemi may also become a viable option due to his availability for about €40m.
A report suggests Napoli is also eyeing Tottenham's Timo Werner and Federico Chiesa from Liverpool as further options.

This ongoing search highlights Napoli's strategic moves in the transfer market to maintain competitiveness following significant player exits.

item.title: Rishabh Pant confirms availability to play Ranji Trophy for Delhi - The Indian Express
item.description:
Rishabh Pant to Play Ranji Trophy After 7 Years, Confirms Availability for Delhi’s Next Match

Publication Date: January 14, 2025
Source: The Indian Express

India wicket-keeper Rishabh Pant has confirmed his availability to feature in Delhi’s Ranji Trophy campaign which will resume on January 23.

  • Pant confirmed he will play against Saurashtra in Rajkot.
  • His last Ranji Trophy match was in December 2017.
  • This confirmation follows his omission from India’s T20I squad for the series against England.
  • The DDCA emphasized the need for senior players, including Virat Kohli, to participate in the tournament.
  • Pant has played in all 10 Tests for India since September 2024.
“Rishabh Pant has confirmed that he will be available for selection for Delhi’s Ranji Trophy game against Saurashtra in Rajkot,” said DDCA secretary Ashok Sharma.

This significant return to the Ranji Trophy highlights Pant's commitment and the BCCI's emphasis on domestic cricket following recent performances.

item.title: Transfer news LIVE: Man Utd in £70m talks, Chelsea deal agreed, Rashford sets deadline - Express
item.description:
Transfer News Live: Man Utd in £70m talks, Chelsea deal agreed, Rashford sets deadline

Date & Source: 28 mins ago, Express

Express Sport is on hand to keep you up to date with the latest transfer news.

  • Manchester United prepares for a busy transfer window with potential signings and loan exits.
  • Rashford has set a deadline for Barcelona regarding his potential transfer, with interest from AC Milan.
  • Aston Villa has confirmed the signing of Donyell Malen from Borussia Dortmund.
  • Liverpool rejected a £70m bid for Darwin Nunez from Al-Hilal.
  • Several Premier League clubs are looking to strengthen their squads.
“Marcus Rashford's situation isn’t good at all, but he could find success away from Old Trafford.” - Tomasz Kuszczak

The ongoing winter transfer market sees major shifts, with marquee players like Rashford and Nunez in focus, making this an essential period for clubs aiming to optimize their rosters.

item.title: Ranji Trophy: Yashasvi Jaiswal available for Mumbai's match against Jammu and Kashmir; Sarfaraz Khan injured - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Yashasvi Jaiswal Available for Mumbai's Upcoming Ranji Trophy Match Against Jammu and Kashmir

Date: January 14, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Yashasvi Jaiswal has confirmed his availability for the Ranji Trophy match against Jammu and Kashmir on January 23, while Sarfaraz Khan will miss the match due to injury.

  • Jaiswal was the leading run-scorer for India during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, scoring 391 runs.
  • The Mumbai Cricket Association confirmed Jaiswal's availability ahead of the selection meeting.
  • Sarfaraz Khan will not play due to a rib injury.
  • Rohit Sharma was spotted training with the Mumbai squad, but it is uncertain if he will play.
  • Other notable players, including Ajinkya Rahane and Shreyas Iyer, may feature if available.
"Yashasvi Jaiswal has confirmed that he is available for the match against Jammu and Kashmir." - MCA Source

This development brings excitement for Mumbai's upcoming cricket fixture and the interest surrounding domestic cricket after recent international losses.

item.title: 'I'm amazed myself' - Karun Nair reflects on record-breaking run - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
I'm amazed myself - Karun Nair reflects on record-breaking run

Publication Date: November 2024 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Karun Nair, currently leading the run-scoring charts in the 2024-25 Vijay Hazare Trophy, reflects on his remarkable performance and how he has come back into form after a challenging period in his career.

  • Nair scored 542 runs without being dismissed, setting a new List A record.
  • In his last six innings, he achieved scores of 122*, 112, 111, 163*, 44*, and 112*.
  • His run of form has significantly helped his team, Vidarbha, reach the semi-finals of the tournament.
  • Nair expressed his amazement at his own performance and commitment to cherishing each moment in cricket.
  • He hopes to leverage his experience for a potential national team call-up as India prepares to tour England.
"I think, quite honestly, it's even amazing to myself also to look at the results that are coming about currently." - Karun Nair

Nair's journey highlights resilience and determination, and he aims to contribute to Vidarbha's success in the ongoing tournament while maintaining focus on his individual performance.

item.title: England pacer of Pakistan origin faces visa delay ahead of T20I series against India: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Saqib Mahmood Faces Visa Delays Ahead of India T20I Series

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

England paceman Saqib Mahmood is experiencing visa delays that will prevent him from attending the team's training camp in Abu Dhabi before the T20I series against India.

  • Mahmood has not received his visa and cannot attend the Abu Dhabi training camp as his passport is with the visa authorities.
  • This situation is reminiscent of last year's similar incident when Shoaib Bashir missed a Test match in India due to a visa delay.
  • Despite the issues, Mahmood is expected to receive his visa soon, allowing him to travel for the upcoming series starting January 22.
  • Other players of Pakistani heritage in the squad, like Rehan Ahmed and Adil Rashid, have successfully obtained their visas.
“The England cricket team faced something similar last year when they travelled to India for the five-match Test series.”

This visa issue highlights ongoing challenges faced by visiting players in securing required travel documents, which can impact team preparation and availability.

item.title: Pakistan pacer boycotts and retires from PSL at the age of 22 - Cricket.com
item.description:
Ihsanullah Retires from PSL at 22, Aims for Domestic Success

Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: [Insert Source]

Pakistan’s fast bowler Ihsanullah has announced his retirement from the Pakistan Super League (PSL) at the age of 22 after going unpicked in the PSL 2025 draft. He expresses a desire to represent Pakistan through domestic cricket instead.

  • Ihsanullah picked up 22 wickets in PSL 2023, finishing as the second-highest wicket-taker.
  • He has recently debuted for Pakistan in both T20I and ODI formats.
  • After suffering an elbow injury that kept him out of the 2024 season, he has struggled to regain his previous form.
  • Post-draft, he declared, “I won’t be seen in the PSL again. I want to represent Pakistan by performing in domestic cricket, not by playing in the PSL.”
“It is a very sad development... his arm will never become perfectly straight.” - Ali Tareen, owner of Multan Sultans

In conclusion, Ihsanullah’s decision marks a significant shift in his career focus, as he aims for recovery and ambitions in domestic cricket.

item.title: Yashasvi Jaiswal available to play Ranji Trophy for Mumbai - The Indian Express
item.description:
Yashasvi Jaiswal Available for Ranji Trophy with Mumbai

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: Indian Express

India Test opener Yashasvi Jaiswal has confirmed his availability for Mumbai's upcoming Ranji Trophy match against Jammu and Kashmir.

  • Jaiswal performed well in the Australian tour, scoring a century and a half century.
  • He will participate in the practice session at Wankhede Stadium on Wednesday.
  • Mumbai's coach Omkar Salvi has been informed about his availability.
  • Sarfaraz Khan will miss the next match due to a rib injury.
  • Rohit Sharma's availability for selection is pending.
“Domestic cricket forms the backbone of Indian cricket and serves as the feeder line to Team India.” - Jay Shah

The return of Jaiswal boosts Mumbai's chances in the Ranji Trophy, especially in light of Sarfaraz Khan's injury.

item.title: Manu Bhaker's Paris Olympics Medals Damaged, International Olympic Committee Says This - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Manu Bhaker's Paris Olympics Medals Damaged, International Olympic Committee Says This

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

India's star shooter Manu Bhaker is set to have her damaged Paris Olympics medals replaced as numerous athletes report similar deterioration issues.

  • Bhaker's bronze medals have had their color come off and are in a deteriorated state.
  • The International Olympic Committee announced that damaged medals will be systematically replaced by the Monnaie de Paris.
  • The replacement process will ensure the new medals are identical to the originals.
  • All of the damaged and defective medals are expected to be swapped out in the upcoming weeks.
  • Bhaker is celebrated as the first Indian female athlete to win two medals in a single Olympics.
“Damaged medals will be systematically replaced...” - IOC Statement

This replacement not only addresses the concerns of Bhaker but also numerous athletes facing similar issues with their medals from the Paris Games.

item.title: 'Exiting' Arsenal star makes it very clear what he thinks of Mikel Arteta's transfer plan - The Mirror
item.description:
Kieran Tierney Supports Arsenal's Pursuit of Martin Zubimendi

Date: October 2023 | Source: Mirror

Kieran Tierney has voiced his support for Mikel Arteta's decision to pursue Martin Zubimendi from Real Sociedad, strengthening Arsenal's squad.

  • Tierney described Zubimendi as a "world-class" player.
  • Arsenal has been targeting Zubimendi for over a year, aiming to replace Thomas Partey.
  • The club is reportedly close to securing his signature with a £51 million release clause.
  • Zubimendi will remain with Real Sociedad until the end of the season, despite interest from other clubs like Manchester City.
“You have world-class players like Zubimendi... It’s hard to know [their quality] if you’re only watching the Premier League every week.” - Kieran Tierney

This acquisition is timely as Tierney is likely to leave Arsenal soon, with speculation about a return to Celtic.
